Class Transaction

java.lang.Object
financialManagement.Transaction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Transaction extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a financial transaction, either a withdrawal or deposit, associated with an account, category, and other relevant details. This class handles the execution of transactions, including withdrawal and deposit operations, and stores transaction details.
See Also:

    Retrieves the type of the transaction (e.g., withdrawal, deposit).
    boolean
    receiveTransaction()

  • Constructor Details

    • Transaction

      public Transaction(double amount, Account account, double transactionID, String transactionType, LocalDateTime transactionDate, String recipientID, Category category, BudgetAnalysisManager budgetAnalysisManager)
      Constructs a new Transaction with specified details.
      Parameters:
      amount - The transaction amount.
      account - The account associated with this transaction.
      transactionID - The unique identifier for the transaction.
      transactionType - The type of transaction (e.g., withdrawal, deposit).
      transactionDate - The date and time when the transaction occurred.
      recipientID - The recipient account ID (for deposit transactions).
      category - The category associated with this transaction.
      budgetAnalysisManager - The budget analysis manager for managing financial data.

  • Method Details

    • getAmount

      public double getAmount()
      Retrieves the amount of this transaction.

      The amount of the transaction.

      public Account getAccount()
      Retrieves the account associated with this transaction.

      Retrieves the unique transaction ID.

    • getTransactionType

      public String getTransactionType()
      Retrieves the type of the transaction (e.g., withdrawal, deposit).
      Returns:

      public LocalDateTime getTransactionDate()
      Retrieves the date and time when the transaction occurred.
      Returns:
      The transaction date.

    • getRecipientID

      public String getRecipientID()
      Retrieves the recipient account ID for a deposit transaction.
      Returns:
      The recipient account ID.

    • getCategory

      public Category getCategory()
      Retrieves the category associated with this transaction.
      Returns:
      The transaction's category.

    • getBudgetAnalysisManager

      public BudgetAnalysisManager getBudgetAnalysisManager()
      Retrieves the budget analysis manager associated with this transaction.
      Returns:
      The budget analysis manager.

    • doTransaction

      public boolean doTransaction()
      Executes a withdrawal transaction from the associated account, reducing the category's budget and the account balance.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction was successfully processed, false otherwise.

    • receiveTransaction

      public boolean receiveTransaction()
      Executes a deposit transaction, adding the specified amount to the associated account.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction was successfully processed, false otherwise.
